intro: Cryptolepis transvaalensis, commonly known as the Transvaal moonseed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by berries that turn red when mature. It is often found in forested areas and along riverbanks, thriving in moist, shaded environments. Cryptolepis transvaalensis is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
